A flaming Sambuca is made by lighting the white drink in a shot glass and allowing it to burn with a small blue flame. The flame is then extinguished by placing the palm of the hand over the top of the glass.

Ingredients [edit]. Sambuca is flavoured with essential oils obtained from anise, star anise, liquorice and other spices. It also contains elderflowers. The oils are added to pure alcohol, a concentrated solution of sugar, and other flavouring. The primary flavoring in sambuca is the essential oils of star anise, which give the drink its distinct licorice flavor. Sugar is typically added to sweeten the drink slightly, and other flavorings such as elderberry can also be added. Sambuca is often served in a shot glass with roasted coffee beans. Diners in Italian cafes consume sambuca to cleanse their mouths after they drink coffee.
